statements.name: PROC CALLRFC
statements.description: Invokes the CALLRFC procedure and specifies the connection and logon information of an SAP system. The connection to the SAP system is established and the logon information is verified.
statements.help:
PROC CALLRFC  <options>;  
	CALL  <FUNCTION> 'function-name'  
		<EXPORTING parameter-1 | 
			parameter-1.field-1 =value-1 < … parameter-n=value-n>>
			<IMPORTING parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 
			< … parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>
			<INTABLES table-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 
			<… table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>
			<TABLES table-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 
			<… table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>
			<CALLBACK <callback-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1
			<… table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>> </ default = SAS-library>;
	DESCRIBE  <FUNCTION> 'function-name' <SHORT>;

arguments.name: ABAPFM=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the ABAP function module that SAS uses internally for metadata requests.

arguments.name: ABAPPROG=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the ABAP program that SAS uses.

arguments.name: ASHOST=
arguments.description: specifies the host name or IP address of a specific application server.

arguments.name: CLASSIC
arguments.description: specifies that the engine and the CALLRFC procedure use the SAP classic RFC library.

arguments.name: CLIENT=
arguments.description: specifies the SAP logon parameter for client.

arguments.name: DESTINATION=
arguments.description: Specify the destination defined in sapnwrfc.ini or saprfc.ini to connect to the SAP system.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies the name for a group of application servers.

arguments.name: GWHOST=
arguments.description: specifies the host name of the SAP gateway.

arguments.name: GWSERV=
arguments.description: specifies the service of the SAP gateway.

arguments.name: HOST=
arguments.description: specifies the host name of the SAS RFC Server.

arguments.name: IEEE_REVERSE=
arguments.description: specifies whether floating-point numbers are byte-reversed.

arguments.name: LANGUAGE=
arguments.description: specifies the SAP logon parameter for language.

arguments.name: LIBREF=
arguments.description: Access the SAP system using connection and logon parameters associated with a libref.

arguments.name: MODE=
arguments.description: specifies the mode for the CALLRFC procedure.

arguments.name: MSHOST=
arguments.description: specifies the host name of the Message Server for the SAP system.

arguments.name: NETWEAVER
arguments.description: specifies that the engine and the CALLRFC procedure use the SAP NetWeaver RFC library.

arguments.name: NUMC_SAS_TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data type for the ABAP type NUMC.

arguments.name: PASSWORD=
arguments.description: specifies the SAP logon parameter for password.

arguments.name: PASSWORDX=
arguments.description: specifies the SAP logon parameter for password in an encrypted form.

arguments.name: PORT=
arguments.description: specifies the port number of the SAS RFC Server.

arguments.name: R3NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAP R/3 system.

arguments.name: RFC_STRING=
arguments.description: specifies additional logon or connection parameters for the RfcOpenEx() call.

arguments.name: _ID=
arguments.description: specifies the string defined for SAPLOGON on 32-bit Windows.

arguments.name: SYSNR=
arguments.description: specifies the SAP R/3 system number.

arguments.name: TRACE=
arguments.description: enables tracing of RFC requests.

arguments.name: USER=
arguments.description: specifies the SAP logon parameter for user.

statements.name: CALL FUNCTION
statements.description: Call an RFC on the SAP system. The CALL FUNCTION statement can be called multiple times within a PROC CALLRFC step. The function calls are executed in sequence.
statements.help:
CALL  <FUNCTION> 'function-name'  
	<EXPORTING parameter-1 | parameter-1.field-1=value-1 
		< … parameter-n=value-n>>
		<IMPORTING parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 
		< … parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>
		<INTABLES table-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 
		<… table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>
		<TABLES table-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1 
		<… table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>
		<CALLBACK <callback-parameter-1=SAS-dataset-name-1
		<… table-parameter-n=SAS-dataset-name-n>>> </ default = SAS-library>;

arguments.name: function-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the ABAP function. The function name is a literal, and it must be enclosed in quotation marks. The function name is converted to uppercase characters. The ABAP function must be RFC callable. It must not have any dialog, and it must be synchronous.

arguments.name: EXPORTING
arguments.description: specifies fields or structures to be passed to the function module. The parameters parameter-1 through parameter-n are defined in the function interface as import parameters.

arguments.name: IMPORTING
arguments.description: specifies the fields or structures to be passed from the function module back to the SAS system. The parameters parameter-1 through parameter-n are defined in the function interface as export parameters.

arguments.name: INTABLES
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data sets to be passed to the function module. The parameters table-parameter-1 through table-parameter-n are defined in the function interface as table parameters. SAS converts the SAS data sets into internal tables and passes it to the function module. The variable names in the SAS data set must match the field names of the internal table as defined for the function interface.

arguments.name: TABLES
arguments.description: specifies names for the SAS data sets to be created from the internal tables in the function module. The parameters table-parameter-1 through table-parameter-n are defined in the function interface as table parameters.

arguments.name: CALLBACK
arguments.description: specifies names for the SAS data sets to be created from the internal tables in the function module. The parameters are not defined in the function interface. The function module must implement a callback mechanism.

statements.name: DESCRIBE FUNCTION
statements.description: Reads metadata about an RFC and writes the information to the SAS log or to a SAS data set using ODS. The DESCRIBE FUNCTION statement can be called multiple times within a PROC CALLRFC step.

arguments.name: function-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the ABAP function. The function name is a literal and it must be enclosed in quotation marks. The function name is converted to uppercase characters.

arguments.name: SHORT
arguments.description: specifies that parameter metadata is printed only in the SAS log. The field metadata is not printed.
